poem:
The Newborn Dream

Shoes hum in the microwave's  
warm embrace—  
an echo of sleepless nights,  
milk-stained kisses.  
In dreams, the baby rolls  
like steam—  
weightless, swift,  
a whisper on the verge  
of waking.  
Tired arms cradle absence;  
yet still,  
the heart beats  
patiently,  
awaiting his return.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Have you ever been tired enough to put your shoes in the microwave? This is my world: welcome! | Nell Frizzell Sleep is a feminist issue. Or should I say, lack of sleep is a feminist issue. During a particularly thickly cut bout of tiredness, when my son was a newborn, I became so convinced that my tiny, milk-stained baby had rolled out of my arms and somehow, unfathomably out of the room, into the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
